about.description:
I'm a computer engineer and game developer currently based in Warsaw. I have a passion for building strange worlds and the sturdy code that supports them. Whether it's a reliable backend system or a game mechanic that lets you play as a destructive cat, I love the process of creation.

On the tech side, I build functional platforms like GamerLog (Django) and creative tools like Bitmapify. I even combined my love for sports and code to build an AI-powered NBA match predictor.

Creatively, I live in Unity and Unreal Engine. I've explored narrative horror in Echoes of Stella, arcade survival in Swarmbreaker, and pure chaos in In A Bad Mewd. I also collaborated on the high-speed sports game Killwats League.

With a degree in Computer Engineering, I'm now diving deeper into the industry through Game Programming at Futuregames. When I'm not debugging, you'll find me making music or jumping into random creative side quests.

portfolioItems.title: Echolocation Mechanic Detailed Showcase

positions.title: Software Engineer
responsibilities: Identified and resolved critical bugs in Java-based applications, improving system stability and performance.
Conducted thorough testing and debugging, ensuring smooth functionality and minimizing downtime.
Designed and deployed Docker containers, optimizing development and production environments for seamless CI/CD workflows.
Managed and resolved Jira tasks, collaborating with cross-functional teams to meet project deadlines efficiently.
Implemented DevOps solutions, automating deployment pipelines and enhancing system reliability through CI/CD integration.
Developed an AI-based NBA match prediction app during the company hackathon using Django, Python, and machine learning.

positions.title: Software Engineer - Intern
responsibilities: Contributed to the Traffic Test Team, analyzing performance and identifying potential bottlenecks.
Developed a web application using Java Spring Boot, enabling employees to reserve test-working environments.
Collaborated with senior developers, gaining hands-on experience in Agile methodologies and full-stack development.

positions.title: Software Engineer - Intern
responsibilities: Explored and learned the Salesforce Cloud Platform, understanding its CRM capabilities and integration with enterprise systems.
Achieved foundational knowledge of Salesforce Administration and Development, including configuring objects, fields, automation rules, and basic Apex programming.
Assisted in cloud-based application development, exploring customization, data management, and deployment within the Salesforce ecosystem.
Participated in team meetings and knowledge-sharing sessions, deepening understanding of cloud infrastructure and CRM solutions.

positions.title: Volunteer Intern
responsibilities: Gained insight into the internal operations of a software company, observing workflows, project management, and client interactions.
Learned and practiced web development, building responsive websites using HTML, CSS, and PHP.
Developed authentication features for a web application, implementing sign-in, sign-out, and user session management using PHP and MySQL.
Assisted in front-end and back-end development, gaining hands-on experience in creating dynamic web pages and database interactions.
Explored software development best practices, including debugging, version control, and UI/UX principles.

degrees.title: Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science (Erasmus)
